metadata.title: CVE-2018-7225 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer through 0.9.11.rfbProcessClientNormalMessage() in rfbserver.c does not sanitizemsg.cct.length, leading to access to uninitialized and potentiallysensitive data or possibly unspecified other impact (e.g., an integeroverflow) via specially crafted VNC packets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

vino - 3.22.0-3ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

italc-client - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
vino package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-3ubuntu1.1').
italc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
